content: Morning Rohan. Just confirming your week starts with light sessions today/tomorrow. Thursday 10am SG time is still locked for the Q1 Strategic Review.
Got it, thanks Ruby. Looking forward to seeing the numbers.
Quick thing my - son's had a persistent cough for 2 weeks. Can you find and book a top pediatric pulmonologist in SG for next week?
On it now. Will coordinate with Sarah so it doesn't conflict with your schedule. I'll revert in a few hours.
All set. Booked Dr. Evelyn Koh at Mount Elizabeth for Wed 3:30pm. Sarah has the details and will arrange transport. Highly rated in pediatric respiratory.
Perfect. Appreciate the quick turnaround.
Morning Rohan - gentle reminder: last week's mobility drills still in play until we start Phase 2 post-review. Just 15 mins before work.
Yep, doing them before coffee. Feeling looser in the hips.
Blood panel results just came in - looking strong. Dr. Warren will walk you through ApoB in detail Thursday.
Great. Curious to see how much we've moved the needle.
Evening Rohan. your CGM last week showed smoother glucose curves with quinoa dinners. Weâ€™ll talk v2.0 tweaks Thursday.
Not bad for something that still tastes good ðŸ˜„
Daylight start. HRV's holding steady despite Monday's late night. Keep hydration up; humid morning in SG.
Copy. Will front-load water before the 9am call.
Rohan, small insight: your Garmin strain scores dip midweek. We can use that window for heavier lifts in Phase 2.
Makes sense. Let's slot those in Fridays.
Happy midweek. Tomorrow's review deck is ready. You'll get a PDF tonight for a skim.
Perfect, I'll glance over it before bed.
Reminder: your son's appointment is in an hour. Sarah confirmed driver's on standby.
Got it. Thanks for keeping that smooth.
Morning Rohan. Today's call is our Q2 Strategic Planning Session. Let's align on big-picture goals & next 12 weeks.
Ready. Excited to hear the deep dive.
ApoB is down from 110 â†’ 96 mg/dL (-12.7%). This is a meaningful reduction for cardiovascular risk. Q2 target: <80 mg/dL.
That's encouraging. Let's push for it.
Nutrition v2.0 builds on your CGM data. Step one: swap white rice for quinoa 4 nights/week to stabilise glucose.
Got it. Easy change.
Strength Phase 2 = progressive overload. Adding 5% weight every 2 weeks on your main lifts, starting tomorrow.
Noted. Will test the new numbers tomorrow.
KPIs locked: 1) ApoB <80, 2) VOâ‚‚ Max +5%, 3) Deadlift 1.25x BW, 4) HRV stability during travel.
Solid targets. Let's make it happen.
Email sent with KPI summary + Rachel's updated Trainerize plan. All set for Phase 2 tomorrow.
Warren, still have a latent fear of old POTS/Long COVID symptoms flaring under stress. What's our proactive strategy for Q2?
We'll monitor orthostatic vitals weekly, track HRV daily, and run a quarterly autonomic panel. Early-warning thresholds are set so we can intervene quickly.
That's reassuring. Thanks for thinking ahead.
Phase 2 day 1. Warm-up + 5% heavier than your last baseline. Log numbers in Trainerize.
Done. Felt challenging but manageable.
Nice start to Phase 2 ðŸ’ª We'll check form with Rachel on Monday.
FYI: travel week starts Oct 8. Let's preload recovery sessions so HRV holds steady.
Makes sense. Slot them Tuesday/Wednesday.
Week wrap: KPIs set, Phase 2 launched, ApoB trending down.
Sent travel plan v2.1 in accordance to Q2 KPIs. Enjoy your Sunday, Rohan.
